detailsOfAchievement: The Action for Women Development and Empowerment (AWDE), is a non-Governmental, non-profit organization formed with a vision of creating an environment where every women irrespective of her class, caste or religion leads quality life in dignity and self respect having control over her own life. In line with the vision of the organization, AWDE strive work for the development and empowerment of women through needbased interventions which consider the totality of the economic and social factors that shape a womenâ€™s environment particularly which effects womenâ€™s ability to control and improve their lives and development. Since inception, AWDE undertakes integrated multi sectoral development programmes and multiple activities to further womenâ€™s interest all over and to develop and empower women in all areas. The thrust area of the organization is creation of appropriate institutions at grassroot level with a believe that through development of skill, leadership and collective action, as well as increasing income and financial resources, an empowering environment will be created to improve womenâ€™s self-esteem, self-confidence and ability to change lives. The organization of rural poor women into a self help affinity group will greatly contribute to raise the socio-economic status of women reaching beyond to impact families and the community in general. Some of the main activities of AWDE are: â€¢ Formation and capacity building of Self Help Affinity Groups at village level; â€¢ Skill building for Women with object of equipping them with skills for alternative livelihood source; â€¢ Strengthening rural artisans and entrepreneurs through design support and rural marketing; â€¢ Reproductive Women & Child Health; â€¢ Day care service for children of working women; â€¢ Rural Livelihood Promotion activities; â€¢ Adult Education â€¢ Support services for the elderly citizens The organization has learned over the years the felt need to improve the socio- economic condition of the rural communities, particularly, women to enhance or enable them to lead a more productive meaningful life. The organization took upon itself the tasks to address this need through the approach of institutional building by promotion of Self Help Affinity Groups at village level. This intervention aims to build employable capacities in the group members by enhancing their skills and by helping them to realize their potentials as individuals and as groups in contributing to make their families and communities stronger- economically and socially which will create a sense of security amongst women and make them less vulnerable. The inputs of the organization includes facilitating of group formation, strengthening the existing ones, Capacity building on group management skills, technical skill building on income oriented trades, provision of small loan to the groups for income generation activities etc. Other support services include building linkages with other departments on schemes for piggery and poultry farms, weaving, and cultivation of vegetables for commercial purpose with the object of leveraging their income. Generally speaking, the rural poor women and girls have very little or no source of income. Most of their time is invested in cultivation works and household chores which have no monetary return. Thus, they literally have no other skill (apart from cultivation) whereby they could practice to generate their own income. The poor can be free from poverty only when they can develop themselves as human beings. We need to build their capacity to equip them with necessary skills and qualities to better their lives. Therefore training remains an important component in the whole developmental process. Thus, to facilitate a self employment process, the organization provides short term vocational training to cater to the training need of the rural women and girls and the unemployed in general.

title: BASILEIA MISSION ORGANISATION
detailsOfAchievement: The Basileia Mission Organization is one of the Non-Government Organization (NGO)located at Dimapur, Nagaland and it is voluntary non-profit and Welfare Organization. The organization works with different aspects of human problems mainly for the well-being and upliftment for the disabled people in an around the Nagaland state with a motto "SRVING WITH LOVE", it has entirely committed for the welfare of mankind, regardless of sex, caste, creed, religion, language and status. Its members shall expressed the need of consciousness to all citizens towards more responsible living, human development, love and care through the voluntary service of the Basileia Mission Organization which was formed on 04-04-02 and registered under societies registration Act of 1860,Reg No H/RS-4408 of dated 12-08-05 Nagaland state. To that end our organization is involved to bring awareness about the need to work among people with disabilities, who are people with:- .Least educated. . Highest unemployment rate. .Least access to transportation. .Most broking marriage. .Hardly any involvement in social activities. Following is a brief description concerning few projects that we have taken up for the betterment of the disabled people in the society. Vocational Training center. we want to generate a sense of dignity in their heart knowing that they do not need to depend on others for help. .Braille Reading .Handicraft .Typing classes .Computer classes .Tailoring .Embroidery .Carpentry .Music .Recreation etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Our NGOs Baseleia Mission Organization is committed to work for the betterment of the society by providing a Life Skill Training, Health Care and awareness camp and we generate a sense of dignity in the hearts of the persons living with disabilities by giving them different types of training to have a chance to live with dignity and hope.

detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES OF BETHESDA YOUTH WELFARE CENTRE I. OUT PATIENT COUNSELLING AND DE-TOXIFICATION: A vital part of the services provided by the BYWCD is the Chemical Addiction outpatient program. The focus is on Chemical dependency counseling. The duration of counseling depends on the individual. II. DE-ADDICTION & REHABILITATION: 15 Bedded de-toxification and rehabilitation program. 3 to 6 months program based on 4 pronged approach viz., Physical , Spiritual, Work and Social Therapy. III. YOUTH EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAM: The programs envisage networking exclusively to the Church group throughout Nagaland by conducting Seminars, Workshops and Training there by shaping public opinion. IV. TARGETED INTERVENTION (IDUs) PROJECTS: BYWCD runs Targeted Intervention Projects in 3 districts of Nagaland targeting the Injecting Drug Users, Funded by Nagaland SACS and EHA/AVAHAN -Project ORCHID. Dimapur: DIC, Duncan/Newmarket Nagaland Gate/Westyard Chumukedima/6th mile Phek: Bethesda B-ELF, Phek Bethesda C-RWS, Pfutsero Bethesda D-TTM, Chozuba Wokha : Bethesda Welfare Club Network DIC, Bhandari Town /Sanis / Merapani / Doyang Activities : - ïƒ˜ Counseling and one to one interaction ïƒ˜ Abscess Care/Treatment ïƒ˜ STI Treatment ïƒ˜ STD, HIV/AIDS referrals & Primary Medical Care and rehabilitation information ïƒ˜ Advocacy Meetings & FGD. ïƒ˜ Awareness on Drugs & HIV/AIDS ïƒ˜ Condom Promotion and Needle & Syringe Exchange Program ïƒ˜ IEC distribution ïƒ˜ Indoor games & Creativity Therapy ïƒ˜ Follow-Up V. RURAL HEALTH & EDUCATIONAL UPLIFTMENT PROGRAM: It was started in the interstate border of Assam-Nagaland on the foothills of Wokha District. The Center conducts free medical camps and awareness on proper health care. A rural Elementary School is also functional since 2001. VI. BETHESDA RURAL CULTURAL CENTRE: This program was set up at Hayiyan Lio-Wokha, Wokha District to bring the people together in a platform, integrating Drugs & HIV/AIDS awareness program by reviving, preserving and promoting the cultural heritage of the people. VII. Centre for Community Transformation The main objective is to provide the best services to the needs of the community. It has an AC conference hall with a capacity to accommodate around 40-50 people. It has a Guest House within the Training Complex with a capacity of 28 guests. VIII. SCENEI CSD - 10 It is working in 18 villages in the Nagaland-Assam Border of Wokha district -Nagaland. This project is being operated in partnership with NE NGO Dialogue Forum (supported by EED). Activities: - ïƒ˜ Promotion of Indigenous seeds ïƒ˜ Formation of food banks ïƒ˜ Seed money and other economic support for SHG ïƒ˜ Awareness creation and Training on Economic Literacy, Gender, Peace globalization and Democratization. IX. Inter-Personal and Community Based Communication (IPC) Supported by Australian International Health Institute (The University of Melbourne) Ltd. (AIHI). The objectives is to reduce Stigma and Discrimination toward PLHAs in Wokha district: ïƒ˜ Capacity building of the women to facilitate change in the community. ïƒ˜ To provide information on HIV/AIDS free from Myths and misconceptions. ïƒ˜ To develop adequate understanding of the different forms of HIV/AIDS related stigma and Discrimination. X. SUBSTITUTION THERAPY PROJECT Funded by EHA-DFID the project focus on reducing the rate of HIV infection amongst the IDUs, by administering Buprenorphine to IDUs thus, avoiding injecting.

isuues.name: Key Issues
isuues.value: Art & Culture,Children,Civic Issues,Differently Abled,Education & Literacy,Environment & Forests,Food Processing,Health & Family Welfare,HIV/AIDS,Land Resources,Micro Finance (SHGs),Micro Small & Medium Enterprises,Nutrition,Rural Development & Poverty Alleviation,Tourism,Vocational Training,Water Resources,Women's Development & Empowerment,Youth Affairs

detailsOfAchievement: AIM & Vision: The society aims to improve the living conditions of the Chakhesang community, especially women, through implementing various activities in the area of health, education, enhancement of livelihoods, promotion of traditional crafts and textiles, and conservation of tradition and heritage. The Chakhesang Women Welfare Society has had the privilege of partnering with a number of Govt. & Non-Governmental agencies during the last 40 years and has been tirelessly working for the upliftment of women in particular and society in general. By the year 2020, the society wishes to see poverty being eliminated from amongst our people specially those in the villages. 1. Vocational Training: In the last 40 years the organization has imparted vocational trainings to more than 3000 women and youth on different skills such as weaving, tailoring, typing, Knitting and food processing. 2. Self Help Groups (SHGs): More than 300 Self Help Groups (SHGs) are initiated and formed under the organization. They are involved in agricultural works, piggery & poultry farming, weaving etc. In order to strengthen the SHGs the society conducts trainings in collaboration with AIACA and NABARD. 3. Joint Liability Group (JLG): Acknowledging the skills and techniques of the farmers & artisans and also to improve the living standards and enhance the financial status of the people 60 Joint Liability Groups are formed. The main emphasis is to link them up for micro credit facilities through which their existing activities can be expanded. 4. Museum: The organization with the view to preserve the traditions and culture of our forefathers established a mini Naga Museum. It is an attraction to the tourists & researchers. 5. Chakhesang Naga Cuisine Booklet: The organization has produced a booklet on Chakhesang Naga Cuisine in 2007 which was well accepted by the Nagas. 6. Attires Book: A book on Chakhesang attires and ornaments called Chakhesang Naga Attires & Ornaments was produced and released by the organization. Its 1st edition was in 1995 and the 2nd in 2016. The 1st edition initiated by our elders is further enriched and enhanced in the 2nd edition. 7. Tribal Development Fund: Tribal Development Fund which is funded by the NABARD by reaching out to 500 families in 8 villages for Horticulture and piggery. This project aims at long term and big scale production which aims at improving the annual income of the poor farmers through practicing intercropping cultivation. The produce of the farmers have already found a market outside the locality. 8. â€œFrom subsistence to prosperity through community led and managed livelihoods program in Phek Districtâ€ supported by Tata Trust: The project started in April 2015 in partnership with North East Initiative Development Agency supported by Tata Trusts. The project will cover 5000 households under agriculture and 4000 households of piggery & allied activities promotion. 9. Education: Under the Alternative & Innovative Schooling Program (SSA) 1137 never enrolled children were mainstreamed. 10. Mother Education: 752 mothers were capacitated with elementary knowledge and one movement that continues to boost the spirits of the organization. CWWS

detailsOfAchievement: We, the Development Association of Disableds Have opened a school in the year 2013 under the name- SILVER LINES ACADEMY with an objective to provide all round educational development to the marginal children and weaker section in our society. The institution started with three teachers, a helper and twenty three students enrolled. The school have grown with thirty students, five teachers and two helpers. We teach children with different disabilities such as intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, down syndrome, hearing impaired, speech impaired and autism. Besides giving them education and dailly social skills, we also organise vocational training for special children in Nagaland and the studends take active part in Special Olympics

detailsOfAchievement: Development Association is the official organ of the catholic Church for planning and coordinating social, charitable, welfare and development activities in Nagaland. We have been working for the social and economic development of the people of Nagaland irrespective of caste, creed and colour. Our main focus has been on rural development, women empowerment, health, Prevention of Substance Abuse and HIV/AIDS, education of poor children, welfare of the Differently abled. In all these areas we have achieved a lot in terms of carrying out meaningful programs and projects reaching out to mainly the last, the lost and the least. One of our main achievements are in the areas of community health through a series of outreach programs and trainging of village health workers and managing rural dispensaries in different parts of Nagaland. Another main achievements are in the field of Substance abuse and HIV/AIDS. A lot of awareness has been created among a cross section of people in the villages, churches and schools. We have also helped a number of people to come out of Substance abuse and get quality treatment, care and support of HIV/AIDS clients through our Community care Centre and Positive living Centre. Another major achievement is in the sector of Women empowerment through Animation and promotion of Peoples organizations like SHGs in different parts of Nagaland. Another achievement is our ability to work in collaboration with various NGOs and Goverment departments.

detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities Report of EFG 2016 April Activities A "Wild Dog" was rescued by EFG Organization from Kangching Village, Longleng District on 15th April, 2016 and donated it to Nagaland Zoological Park (NZP), Dimapur on Saturday 16th April, 2016. Deputy Ranger, NZP, Shri. Thripong Sangtam also encouraged and appreciated the EFG Organization for the concerning over the protection of Wildlife in particular and Environment in general. In addition, EFG and NZP will look forward to collaborate with each other in days to come. Earth Day 2016 Earth Day 2016 was observed by Earth Friendly Generation with the theme, â€œGreenery for the Future Generation (EFG)â€ at Chiephobozou on 22nd April, 2016. It was a wonderful program. Altogether around 400 people participated in the earth friendly awareness program from various Govt., departments, Assam Riffles, Nagaland Police, schools, churchs, association, clubs and institution having office at Chiephobozou. Special guest of the program was EAC, Shri RuopfÃ¼kuotuo Nuodi, during the short speech he highlighted the importance of the Environment Protection and the impact of the global warming. He also said that everyone should preserve and love the nature. To show that we can plant trees, he stated. Besides that he has encourage the EFG teams for such initiatives and assure to give full support in the days to come from administrative side. In Summing up, Live demo on Earth Day 2016 was presented by the Students from, Govt Hr. School, Chiechama, Don Bosco Hgh School, Govt High Schoool, Govt Middle School, Chiephobozou Town. Followed by tree plantation with a name plate initiated by EAC and the departments concern present for the day. June Activities More than 2000 tree saplings have been donated by EFG to various NGOs, Studentsâ€™ Unions, Associations ; Namely - Crankers Cycling Environment Club, Childline Kohima, Adolescent Girls Club under Nagaland Social Welfare Board, St. Josephâ€™s College Jakhama Philanthropy Association, Gideon Associations Zakhama and individuals in the month of June 2016. July Activities EFG Director, Keduolhoukho Chadi attended 1 (one) Interaction Programe with Global ACUMEN Fellowship on 8th July, 2016 at Niathu Resort, Dimapur. Cleanliness Drive On 16th July 2016, Earth Friendly Generation (EFG) and well wisher had carried out Cleanliness Drive and Beautification of Park at Chiephobozou Town. In a statement, EFG organized this cleanliness drive to keep the surroundings clean for healthy living and better environment. 1st Inter School Drawing Competition Earth Friendly Generation (EFG) organized the 1st Inter School Annual Drawing Competition on 20th July 2016 at EFG Conference Hall, held on the theme â€œUnity is Strength, Let us protect our Environmentâ€ with various schools under Chiephobozou Block Kohima Nagaland, where 24 students enthusiastically participated in the competition. Mr Kezhalhoubei Kezieo of Don Bosco School, Chiephobozou bagged the first prize, followed by Visituo Rio from Govt. High School, Nerhema and Langphong Mehishu from Govt. Hr. Sec. School, Chiechama. Ketoulhounuo from Govt. Middle School, Tekhuzie Nerhema received the peopleâ€™s choice award. They all received a cash prize and citation.

detailsOfAchievement: Recognizing the importance of developing Entrepreneurship, the Government of Nagaland declared two consecutive years from 2010 to 2012 as the "Year of the Entrepreneur" a flagship program to develop entrepreneurship especially among the youth. Commemorating this, the Govt of Nagaland bestowed a cash award of 10 Million (In Rs.) to EA in 2010 and enabled EA to create a Seed Fund of 25 Million (In Rs.) in 2011. We have been privileged to receive other recognitions including the prestigious Naga Mothers Association (NMA) Award of 2003 and also the Citizens Based Initiative Award 2001 with Rs.1 Lakh cash award, given by Ashoka Innovators for the Public based, Washington DC, USA. This year, EA has also been awarded the prestigious Social Entrepreneur of the Year (SEOY) 2016 in India by the World Economic Forumâ€™s initiative Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship for its work on entrepreneurship.
